result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin A. LaCourse was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kevin A. LaCourse is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kevin A. LaCourse was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: sentences in Portage County cases 09CF107 and 04CF293

superMiscConds.notes: Court ordered financial obligations to be paid 90 days prior to discharge from ES.
Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, 12 hours community service per week.

Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed. 

No bars, taverns or club houses where the primary source of income/primary activity is the sale/distribution/consumption of alcoholic beverages.

AODA and follow through.  Assessment treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department.  

DNA sample.
To be paid at rate of at least $100.00 per month while on Extended Supervision.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: sentences in Portage County case 09CF107 and 04CF293

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Restitution hearing on July 7, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:09 am 
INCLUDES 15CF747 AND 15TR3983. 
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Julie Sawyer. 
State notes refusal in 15TR3983 should be deemed reasonable. COURT deems refusal reasonable. Atty Sawyer notes a stipulation and order was submitted in 15TR3983 which dismissed that charge. 
Parties have reviewed PSI in 15CF747 and have no additions/corrections. 
Argument. 
Deft makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 

COURT ORDERS: On Ct. 1 (OWI 9th)>>9 years imprisonment - 4 years IC and 5 years ES - CONDITIONS of ES>>absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptons taken as prescribed; no bars, taverns, or club houses where the primary source of income/primary activity is the sale/distrubution/consumption of alcoholic beverages; AODA and follow through; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or it not, 12 hours CS per week; restitution in amount to be determined - to be paid out of 25% of prison wages during confinement and then remaining restitution to be paid in an amount to be determined by the agent during ES; 3 years dl revocation; 3 years IID; 6 pts against dl; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT ORDERS any court ordered financial obligations to be paid 90 days prior to discharge from ES.  
COURT ORDERS sentence to run consecutive to sentences in Portage County Case numbers 09CF107 and 04CF293. 
COURT finds the deft entitled to 56 days sentence credit. 
COURT finds the deft is NOT eligible for CIP 
COURT finds the deft is eligible for SAP. 
COURT remands deft into custody of MCSD for transport to WI State Prison System. 
COURT allows counsel to retain copies of PSI and reminds them to maintain confidentiality. 
COURT advises parties to see JA to set restitution hearing. 
Adj: 11:48 am 

Clerk amends minutes on 5/9/2016 at 3:41 pm

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:21 am 
INCLUDES 15CF747, 15TR3979, 15TR3980, AND 15TR3981. 
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Julie Sawyer.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CF747: Ct. 2 (OWI Cause Injury (2+))>>DISMISS. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Obstructing an Officer)>>D&RI. 
In 15TR3979: Ct. 1 (Failure to Keep Vehicle Under Control)>> DISMISS. 
In 15TR3980: Ct. 1 (License Restriction Violation - Class D or M Vehicle)>>DISMISS. 
In 15TR3981: Ct. 1 (Type 1 Motorcycle Permittee Operate Cycle with Unqualified Passenger)>>DISMISS. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: In 15CF747: Ct. 1 (OWI 9th)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: PSI to be completed within 6 weeks. 
Sentencing Hearing set for 4/19/2016 at 11:00 am in Br. 3. 
Bond Continues.

Shall not consume alcohol. No driving whatsoever. No bars, taverns, liquor stores, or beer tents.   No contact with J.B. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202-Day report within 1 business day of release from custody.
